line_1: Hope is the growth of Earth, the only Plant,
line_2: Which either Heav'n, or Paradice cou'd want.

line_1: Why should you nurse this Stranger Plant,
line_2: With what your Sons, in time, may want;

line_1: Where silent Waters wash the growing Plant.
line_2: The Ox-ey'd Race the slimy Coverts haunt,

line_1: With chaplets twin'd from every weeping plant:
line_2: I see her deck the solitary haunt

line_1: Nor wholesome Herb was found, nor healing Plant,
line_2: None, none were found when I bewail'd their Want;

line_1: Oh! fondly cherish then the lovely plant,
line_2: Its lustre shall thy summer hours enchant,

line_1: The seed sown there, how vigorous is the plant!
line_2: Oh bless'd effect of penury and want,

line_1: She left thee like a shooting plant,
line_2: "For only thee I had to vaunt,

line_1: The trees decay, each flow'r, and balmy plant
line_2: Pine at their roots, and vital humour want:

line_1: Delight is a Rich tender Plant
line_2: Must watch its Seasons, and frequent its Haunt.

line_1: Sweep down the Corn, and bend the growing Plant;
line_2: So restless Winds would fly without Restraint,

line_1: That I may Read, and Ride, and Plant,
